meanings.definition: A system of forced labor camps in China.
meanings.sent1: The laogai was a place where people were made to work against their will.
meanings.sent2: Many individuals were sent to the laogai for political reasons.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a vacation in a laogai would be a terrible joke.
meanings.sent4: The laogai was a dark shadow looming over the lives of many.
meanings.sent5: The horrors of the laogai were etched into the memories of those who survived.

meanings.definition: The Chinese government's system of prison labor camps.
meanings.sent1: In China, the laogai was where prisoners were forced to work.
meanings.sent2: The laogai system aimed to reform prisoners through hard labor.
meanings.sent3: Imagine a world where going to the laogai was a common punishment.
meanings.sent4: The laogai stood as a symbol of oppression and control.
meanings.sent5: The stories of suffering in the laogai were heartbreaking and real.

meanings.definition: A Chinese term meaning 'reform through labor.'
meanings.sent1: The concept of laogai emphasized changing behavior through work.
meanings.sent2: People in China understood the importance of the laogai in society.
meanings.sent3: Trying to convince a lazy person to love the laogai would be a tough sell.
meanings.sent4: In a way, the laogai was a school for hard lessons.
meanings.sent5: The word 'laogai' carried the weight of discipline and transformation.
